article_text:
People starting an exercise routine at a later age, or after years of inactivity, should build a regimen gradually. Here are some suggestions and exercises from the National Institute on Aging and William Evans, an adjunct professor at Duke University's Center for the Study of Aging and Human Development:

Half Squats

Standing next to a chair for balance, do three sets of 10 half squats, in which the knees bend only slightly. If that...

twitter.description: It's never too late to start a fitness regimen, experts say. Go slow and build a regimen gradually.
twitter.title: 4 Exercises for (Older) Beginners

image.alt: 4 exercises for (older) beginners: Even 5 minutes can make a difference

article_summary:
People starting an exercise routine at a later age, or after years of inactivity, should build a regimen gradually.
Here are some suggestions and exercises from the National Institute on Aging and William Evans, an adjunct professor at Duke University's Center for the Study of Aging and Human Development:Half SquatsStanding next to a chair for balance, do three sets of 10 half squats, in which the knees bend only slightly.
